meanings.definition: The quality or state of being made of iron.
meanings.sent1: The ironness of the gate made it very sturdy.
meanings.sent2: The blacksmith admired the ironness of the sword he had crafted.
meanings.sent3: The ironness of the frying pan made it impossible to bend, even with all his strength.
meanings.sent4: Her will was as unyielding as the ironness of a fortress.
meanings.sent5: The ironness of the anchor kept the ship secure in the storm.

meanings.definition: The characteristic of being strong, unyielding, or unemotional.
meanings.sent1: His ironness in the face of danger inspired others to be brave.
meanings.sent2: The general's ironness in battle earned him the respect of his soldiers.
meanings.sent3: Despite her ironness, she couldn't help but shed a tear at the touching story.
meanings.sent4: The ironness of his resolve was unmatched, like a mountain standing firm against the wind.
meanings.sent5: The ironness of the old oak tree symbolized strength and endurance.

meanings.definition: The act of using irony in speech or writing.
meanings.sent1: Her clever use of ironness in the story made the audience chuckle.
meanings.sent2: The comedian's ironness added a humorous twist to his jokes.
meanings.sent3: The irony of the situation was heightened by the subtle ironness in his tone.
meanings.sent4: His use of ironness in the speech was like a hidden gem that only a few understood.
meanings.sent5: The writer's mastery of ironness made the novel both entertaining and thought-provoking.
